item.title: Paula add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Paula add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Paula add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Paula add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Just because you can doesn't mean you should." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Paula add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Sometimes things have to go wrong in order to go right." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Paula add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Paula add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided." -- Mae West

item.title: Paula add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, aye, Sassenach. I am your master . . . and you're mine. Seems I canna possess your soul without losing my own." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Paula add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself. A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough without ever having felt sorry for itself." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Paula add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Paula add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Paula add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding. " -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Paula add a quote by Jeaniene Frost
item.description: "Ask me if I sparkle and I’ll kill you where you stand.” (Bones)" -- Jeaniene Frost

item.title: Paula add a quote by Sierra Cartwright
item.description: "BDSM is about dropping the pretenses; I want you completely exposed." -- Sierra Cartwright

item.title: Paula add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi

item.title: Paula add a quote by Louis de Bernieres
item.description: "Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident." -- Louis de Bernieres

item.title: Paula add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I do not want to be the leader. I refuse to be the leader. I want to live darkly and richly in my femaleness. I want a man lying over me, always over me. His will, his pleasure, his desire, his life, his work, his sexuality the touchstone, the command, my pivot. I don’t mind working, holding my ground intellectually, artistically; but as a woman, oh, God, as a woman I want to be dominated. I don’t mind being told to stand on my own feet, not to cling, be all that I am capable of doing, but I am going to be pursued, fucked, possessed by the will of a male at his time, his bidding." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Paula add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen
